column14: I bought this watch mainly for the night light. I wake up most nights to use the boys' room, and I like to know what time it is so I can decide if I want to try to fall back asleep or just get up and get on with my day. But the light on this watch is completely useless. It doesn't even illuminate the hour digit, so I have no clue what time it is. It is cheap and lightweight, so I gave it two stars. We'll see how long it lasts, though. I just got it a few days ago. I don't think I'll get this one again once it breaks or fails or I just get sick of it. I'll have to fork over a little more money, I guess.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: After about 4 months of use, water leaked in and the watch stopped functioning properly. I used the watch about 10 times in a swimming pool. The watch is marked water resistant and the details on the Amazon website says it's water resistant to 30 meters (100 ft.) and then says Will withstand accidental splashes but not suitable for swimming. I did not notice this qualification when I bought the watch. The bottom line is don't use this watch for swimming or other water activities where the watch is in the water for more than a few seconds.

column14: The F91W is a great watch, but I'd recommend finding a different source than Amazon for them if you want the best F91 you can get. I went through 3 watches from amazon, every single one had varying degrees of noticeable bubbling in the crystal. My f91 purchased in a local watch store and one I purchased directly from Casio did not have these issues at all. The watches still function, they're authentic and keep good time. If you don't care about finish flaws and just need a functional watch, definitely snag one here for the cheap price.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: This watch was smaller than expected. As a 6'6 270lb man, this watch looks like a toy on me, but this is not why I am leaving two stars. To me this watch should do 3 things. Tell me the date, tell me the time, and have a quality back-light. The time an date are perfect. But the backlight is not the full screen on some other name brand watches. It is a small, weak light on the far left of the face that only really illuminates the hour and not the minute. As someone who checks what time it is while laying in bed, this was a let down. For 10 bucks, it would make a good watch for a kid or wife to have a burner watch, but that is it. In my opinion, go with the 30 dollar casios that arent knockdown models.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: The watch itself functions perfectly fine. It has an alarm, shows the days of the week, and has a light, but the light is not very powerful. Overall, it's a decent watch. (I would give it 4-5 stars if it was just fine and this was it.) My issue with the watch is that it gave me an allergic reaction on my wrist exactly where the plastic was in contact with my skin. I think there is a toxic chemical in the plastic that I'm having a reaction to, and it's taken at least two days for my skin to actually heal. If you look at the photo very closely, you'll see that the skin area looks like it has a lot of tiny bumps on it. (This is AFTER several days of not wearing it and letting my skin heal.) When I wear it, my skin turns red, gets a lot of bumps, and it itches. It makes me sad to write this review because I was really looking forward to wearing this watch and enjoying it for a long time. I won't be able to unfortunately. :( I'll be looking to return it and report the issues.

column14: I realize that this is a very inexpensive sport watch, but that is what I was looking for. I wear my watch to bed at night and like to check what time it is if and when I wake it. Unfortunately the light in this watch is totally non-functional. It doesn't light up anything so you can read it. Also, between the dark dial and the dark LED numerals, I could not read the time during the day if I was in a dark area unless I had on reading glasses. I believe the watch keeps good time, but I needed something else. I gave it to my 10 year old grandson and he loves it!

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I LOVED this watch. I wore this model for 5 straight years without removal - maybe a every few months to clean - took showers with it, swam in the ocean, swimming in pools, etc. It held up like a champ; I never had a problem with it. The day/dates/alarms function and layout is simply the best. Alas, the rubber wrist strap eventually broke and I had to buy a new one. I've purchased four of these watches in the past year. Unfortunately within a couple of weeks of showering with it on, the face starts to fog up with moisture. It eventually turns into water drops and the face dies. I loved this watch so much that I bought three more, hoping that I got a dud. I live in Philadelphia and it was a humid summer. I made sure not to shower in the watch to prevent the moisture build-up, but the humidity alone - and perhaps very minimal splashing from hand-washing? - caused moisture to sneak into the watch face. I am very upset that I cannot wear this model any longer and will have to find an alternative that is more water resistant. I've never left reviews but I truly did love this watch and my heart is too broken to keep quiet. It hurts me to advise that folks should stay away from this item.
column16: Shame - was the best watch ever, it is awful now

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I bought this watch because the item page indicates an LED light and I need a watch I can see at night because that's when I'll be wearing it. This watch only has a little light on the left side of the screen. The problem with that little light is the fact, it remains on the left side of the screen; it does not light up the screen at night-time. I found myself straining my eyes to see the time on this watch at night. If you're in need of a watch you can clearly see at night by means of a bright LED screen, this is NOT the watch for you! I am very disappointed with this purchase. Will not buy again.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I have had four or five of this model watch over the last several years. For each one, one of the four "brackets" that holds one end of the strap pin broke off within a year which made each of the watches useless. Consequently, I had to buy new ones. I have kept buying the same watch over and over because I like their functions and they are very inexpensive. But I guess you get what you pay for. Secondly, a strap recently broke on my latest watch, so I went to replace the strap with one from one of my previously broken watches and found that the straps appear to be non-replaceable because the strap pins are permanently affixed to the watch rather than being spring loaded as in most watches. So I wouldn't recommend this watch until they fix the design flaw.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: Purchased this to replace a Casio W-201 whose watch band has failed. An important function is the ability to read the time at night when there is little to no ambient light, so the display light is essential. Unfortunately the light is not bright enough to light up the display. In addition, the button to engage the light is on the upper left instead of the upper right, making it awkward to use. I would return the watch if the packaging had not already been thrown out.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: The watch certainly keeps very good time but that's where it ends. The light is not bright enough to be very useful at all. The alarm is too quiet to hear if there is any significant ambient noise. The biggest problem, however, is the length of the band. While I am not small, I feel that I have a normal sized wrist and this watch is tight even on the last hole. In addition, because the band is so short, on the last hole or two the tail of the band does not remain in the retainer and sticks out, hanging up on the sleeve of my shirt. The band needs to be an inch or so longer. If you have a small wrist, this watch would be fine if you don't care about the light or the alarm.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: TLDR: skip this one and get a different Casio. Gets dirty too quickly. I suppose this is inevitable with crystal resin but still disappointing as it is a really cute watch. column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I have owned several Casio watches over the past 3 decades. I like them because they are durable, easy to use, and don't cost a lot of money. Previous other brand watches were more expensive and could not hold up to the demands that my job did to these watches. I scuba dive and believe it or not my Casio watches have held up fine while diving as deep as 110 feet. So much to my surprise this purchase the watch's light is so dim that I can only see the hour and not the minutes. I don't know if this is just my watch or this model or what, but consider this feature's low performance when purchasing.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: So, I like to wear a watch around the house and when I sleep. I have a decent sized watch collection, but few things I consider to be my home utility watch. I wanted to add to that collection, so that was the mindset I had for this piece. This piece has a lot of history, which is cool, and it serves the primary function of telling time fine. However, there is some utility it lacks, and in all honesty I would tell you to pass on this watch. So hear is what I can say: Intended Use: Around the house utility with need for in the dark functionality. That said it fared ok at this. It is pretty small, but very clear to read. It is a very small thin watch, even on my skinny wrists, but still is able to be read in a lit room or outside easily. I do enjoy that I do not notice it, which makes it easier for doing tasks without snagging it or having it impede mobility. The negative is that this light is the worst I have ever had on a watch. You get the hour and that is about it. This really killed the use for me as I like to be able to check the time quickly at night without the use of my phone. Also, I use my watches for cooking, and without a countdown timer, there goes another aspect of functionality I would like. Remember it has a stopwatch, but no countdown timer. My recommendation would be to spend an extra ten bucks and get the really cool Casio World Time that gives you a better light, timer, stopwatch, and different time zones for travel. It is also a lot bigger and easier to read at night. I greatly prefer that watch. This watch however does do a killer job of telling you the time and date, and if you are looking for something with the least amount of wrist-presence while telling you the time effectively then this is a great watch. If you want much more out of it, there is a lot better for not a lot more money.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: The last couple of these I've bought (I've been wearing Casio watches for many years) were the larger, bulkier Sport models, which have larger, easier to read screen, and a few more features -- but much bulkier, and the straps were always oversize for my small wrists. Maybe that's one reason the bands never last long? But my guess is, poor Chinese plastic & quality control. My last two watches still work, and keep perfect time -- but it's a real pain to change the band. So when it broke, I thought, hell with it. For ten bucks... These would likely fit women too, who prefer this style of watch. It is absurd to have to toss a perfectly good watch (w/ a 10-yr battery!) in the drawer, b/c the new band costs as much as a new watch! It is also annoying that each different Casio module has a different time-set sequence. This one is even LESS intuitive than the last. Bah. I just attempted to link instructions on how to turn off the annoying hourly beep -- since the instructions Casio supplies flat don't work. So I guess you're on your own. Hint: boxerwatches[dot]com instructions do work. Black mark to Amazon for blocking my comment!

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I bought this to replace my AE1200WH after it broke at the lug. Before that one I had an AE1000W, which is the same as the 1200WH (it just looks different). I bought this because I wanted to try a slightly cheaper watch. However, I'd go back to the AE1200WH in a heartbeat. If you have a couple extra bucks, buy an AE watch. I wish I had known that F91-W's had push pins instead of spring pins. I intended on changing the strap for a NATO strap when I unboxed it, but it took a lot of effort to take them out without scratching the plastic. I could've just gotten an AE Casio. They have wide spring-loaded pins, which will make changing straps easier, and give you more strap options. This watch beeps whenever you press buttons, and you can't turn it off (you can in both AE models). The built-in light doesn't really do much, while the AE models light up the whole display. AE models tell you the month. AE models also have world time, a longer stopwatch, and a timer countdown function. You can swim and take a shower with an AE and still keep your warranty. Plus, the AE1200WH looks a lot nicer than the F91-W, and I've gotten a bit of attention when I wear the AE. Anyway, enough comparing this watch to the AE. The F91-W is still a great watch and tells me all I need to know at a moment's glance. Very useful for a kid with only a few bucks in his pocket who doesn't need a million features on his wrist.
column16: Affordable, but would spend more to get a better watch

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: The backlight on this watch is the dimmest Iâ€™ve ever had on a watch. Itâ€™s really only useful if youâ€™re in complete darkness. I wasnâ€™t expecting a lot, but wow itâ€™s very dim, like barely there. I understand itâ€™s an old design but I have random knock-off watches with incredibly bright backlights, so Iâ€™m surprised Casio still sells them like this. The display is very clear but oddly only if you look at it straight on. If you tilt the watch away from you a little the numerals fade. But if you like the look it does look good and minimal.

column14: Almost as if the Casio gods were watching over me, I started having issues with this watch after I submitted my initial review a couple weeks ago. The watch seems to die often, with the screen going blank and the watch resetting itself several minutes later (losing the time I had set on it). The bottom-right button almost never registers when I press it, making it borderline impossible to change the settings (time, alarm, stopwatch, 12/24h, etc.). I guess you get what you pay for, and because of that, I'm not really upset by it -- the watch is really cheap after all. Just wish it would've lasted longer because I don't want to go through the effort of buying a new watch once a year.

column14: Well, first of all, Casio make some very good affordable digital watch since the 70s, but this particular model is ok for the price, but I definitely would not recommend to people with a larger wrist, I donâ€™t personally like the over-size watch that is available right now, itâ€™s so pretentious and definitely lack elegant, itâ€™s like wearing a washing machine on your wrist. I personally prefer the vintage watch size, and 36 inch is probably the sweet spot. However, somehow this watch being a digital watch, the digital screen is kind of small, it wasted a lots of usable space on the dial, and the digital time is hard to read unless you hold it up close, the band barely fit my 7 inch wrist, and the night light is totally useless, so dim-you wonder why bother, overall, you are probably better off buying the the older Casio digital watch with the bigger read out and of course not the oversized Casio they offer today especially in the G-Shock category. l always wonder why can they just make a smaller G-Shock for men, I would buy one for sure.

column14: These Casio watches are the best watches out there for function and waterproofing. I swim and shower and jacuzzi in them regularly and they are tough and wonderful. This particular clear version became slightly yellow and discolored after only a few months, probably from Chlorine, and then went dead after only 18 months. I can't find a better watch so I'm buying it again! Definitely only worth $10 with how often they break, but the market for these awesome watches is slim so I'm stuck overpaying.

column14: My first purchase of this time piece iwas wonderful . This was my second watch as I broke the 1st one. I didn't care for the strap that came with it and bought a velco strap (Amazon.com - Voguestrap TX51012BK Allstrap 16-20mm Black Adjustable-Length Perforated Nylon Sport Strap Watchband) to replace the strap with the buckle. I had an awful time trying to take the stiff posts off the time piece, as it wouldn't slide out and did not have the spring collapsible post that is much easier to remove and install. It was extremely difficult to push or slide the posts out of the holes. As a result I had to bend the post to get it off. After finally getting it off the time piece, I straightened the post and struggled to install my preferred watch band. To add insult to injury, the light did not cover the entire time piece and I could see only the hour numbers and not minute numbers in the dark. I could have returned to have it replaced, but didn't feel like going through the aggravation of contacting Amazon to arrange an exchange and I certainly didn't want to go through the hassle again of transferring the preferred watch band to the replaced time piece.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: Don't get me wrong. Casio makes really good watches and sells them at a very low price. This watch, the F91W-1 is a great example of this....HOWEVER....they compromise drastically with the watch band. I have a very average size wrist but am forced to use the second to last hole in the band. By doing so, the keeper which you tuck the "remainder" of the band into is barely able to hold it. It would not cost much, if even a dollar to lengthen the bands on watches like the F91W-1. The F28-W is another one with short-band-itis. Because of the way the band is somewhat integrated into the design of the watch, changing/upgrading bands is not easy to do. Plus, removing and reinstalling the pins which secure the band to the watch is almost sure to damage the plastic tabs they mount in. Trust me, I've done it. One of Casio's best budget-priced watches, in my opinion, is the W201-1AV. Ample band length, shows day/month & date without pushing a button, PLUS a 10-year battery. Casio, please upgrade the bands on the other aforementioned watches among others.

I wear it in the shower, in long hours in the sun, granted, but FYI If you do those things after ~3-4 months the band will be quite yellow. Still love it, and still purchasing another but just a heads up to potential buyers.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: The Casio F91W-1 Classic Resin Strap Digital Sport Watch is a popular and affordable timepiece that has been around for decades. Despite its simple design, this watch has a lot to offer. Pros: Affordable: This watch is priced very affordably, making it accessible to a wide range of consumers. Lightweight: The watch is very lightweight and comfortable to wear, which makes it suitable for all-day wear. Durable: The watch is made from high-quality materials and is built to last, which means you can expect to get years of use out of it. Water-resistant: The watch is water-resistant, which makes it suitable for everyday wear, even in wet conditions. Easy to read: The digital display of the watch is clear and easy to read, which makes it easy to tell the time at a glance. Cons: Small screen: The screen of the watch is quite small, which may make it difficult to read for some users. Overall, the Casio F91W-1 Classic Resin Strap Digital Sport Watch is a reliable and affordable option for those in need of a basic timepiece. With its lightweight design, water-resistant construction, and clear digital display, this watch is a great choice for everyday wear.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: The Casio F-91W is a nice watch for the price. I had one of these in stainless almost 40 years ago while I attended university classes, and it took a lot of abuse but kept good time. I bought this one mainly for the stopwatch. The only problem is the stopwatch is only good for 59 minutes and 59 seconds. My 5-mile walks are ~80 minutes which means I have to reset it during the walk to get full walk time. Itâ€™s lightweight and small enough to not feel heavy on the arm during the walks. At 1 3/8 inches wide (excluding buttons) and 1 Â½ inches in height (band to band clasps included), it is unobtrusive on the wrist. I have not used the alarm, so no comment there. The back is stainless steel, which makes it more durable and perhaps more sweat resistant. Overall, a good watch for the money. The 4 star rating is due to the stopwatch function limitations, otherwise it would be a 5 star rating.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I love this watch. What I love most about this watch is the compact light-weight feel of it. It is simple to use and has decent functions. I use this watch for everyday use, including hiking/camping. When I use it for everyday life here in Southern California, it does exactly what I want it to do; tell me time. Not much more you can ask for. When I take it hiking/camping, I notice some problems. First is that the light button sucks. It is located poorly on the top left corner and the light it gives off is pretty crappy. I can read the time, but it could display the time better. Also the light only stays on while pushing on the button; I'd prefer the watch to light up for a few sec after pushing the button once. The second problem is that there is condensation within the screen in hot or cold weather. Idk what it is exactly, but a somewhat thick layer of water solidifies under the screen in certain temperatures and conditions. Reading the time because very difficult when this occurs. The screen eventually clears up and looks good again when conditions get better, but it shouldn't happen at all. I wonder about the water-resistance capabilities of this watch. I'm afraid to even shower with it on. It gets an A for scratch-resistance however. I've brushed against trees, bushes, etc and the screen still looks great. Overall it's a great introductory watch for a low price of 11$. It has been very useful to me and I'm glad I bought it. If this watch was 15$+ though, I don't think I would buy it again; for 10$ I would. I will however be upgrading to a more expensive watch next time for a truly water-tight seal (very important to me because I go to lakes, rivers, and streams a lot).

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: This watch is nothing fancy. It has a built-in stop watch, light and alarm (in addition to displaying the day of week - Mon, Tue, etc., time, and day - 1st, 2nd, etc.). This watch also has 12/24 Hour mode so you can see the time in 1pm or 1300 formats (i.e. military time). I typically do not wear a wrist watch but use my cellphone instead. Due to circumstances of a camp I volunteer at, cellphones are not allowed so I needed an inexpensive replacement wrist watch that is nothing fancy (since I don't normally wear a watch and will go back to using the cellphone for time when not at this particular camp). This watch does the basic functions well. There are only two negatives I would give: 1) the wrist band is a little short. For an adult reasonably muscular male (not sure what what my wrist diameter is), I was able to get the band around my wrist but ended up using the second-to-last hole in the band. Not a big deal but something to be aware of. 2) The light is NOT a back-light in that it does NOT light up the back of the watch face. Instead, the light is mounted on the left side of the display face and shines from left to right. This causes you to need to give the display a close look when using the light feature in low / dark ambient lighting. As I've noted, I was looking for a BASIC / inexpensive watch and this one, even with the above two negatives, fits the bill nicely. Would I buy this again if I were in the market - yes, I would.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: UPDATE: after purchasing in 2018 and it now being middle of 2022 the watch is still just as great. the watch band is still intact and going strong, battery and time keeping are excellent. It is probably the watch I am most connected to. the F91 is easily forgettable on wrist. I love this little watch. I will go a few months without wearing it but unlike my mechanical watches its still ticking and ready to go. if the size is a concern id reccomend the w17 as its basically a modernized version (larger, better water resistance, backlight). I've had this watch for 2 years now and have worn it off and on during this time. When I wear it it's on 24/7 in the shower and work for long periods. I've worn it on a deployment in the desert and it hasn't let me down. The backlight is ok, I personally don't think its as bad as people say. It allows you to read the time in the dark. The band has held up so far. Oh and it keeps excellent time. Many would opt to throw it out when it breaks but ill replace the battery and maybe put it on a NATO strap. Just because its cheap doesn't mean it's meant to be disposable.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I must say before I begin this review: I was extremely ambivalent as to whether this watch is a 3 or 4 star product. As soon as I received this watch, I immediately thought it was too small, which may or may not be a good thing depending on you. I've been using my brother's G-Shock for quite a while now, and it's uncomfortable (despite all of the hype) and way too bulky! So, because of how this picture depicted the size (where the batteries go), I bought this watch. Also, the G-Shock and many other expensive watches have many designs at the sides of the back as opposed to this watch's straight round design, which makes it ergonomic. In addition, this watch is REALLY light, which again, can be good or bad. But here comes my major gripe. This watch's lighting aspect is so bad that I wouldn't even wear it if I got paid $15 to (which funnily is what happened because when I tried to refund it, Amazon politely accepted my refund AND surprised me by saying I can keep the watch too)! The light: First of all, the button for the light on this watch is so tiny which may make it hard to find for some people and also to push. But if you do manage to push the button, the light only stays on as long as you push it, and to completely kill the entire glory of the watch, the light is horrendous! I was so disappointed. Seriously, this light is so bad and only barely covers the left side of the watch. What was Casio thinking?! I would also like to add that the design of this watch is so simple and kind of boring, but once again...it's so comfortable as opposed to other bulky watches! And because of the thinness, it's much easier to slide on tight men (or women's) clothing such as dress shirts, etc. I would recommend this watch if you are willing to ignore the poorly-designed lighting portion and the ordinary look. *Unrelated* After analyzing carefully a few other inexpensive watches, I came across Casio Men's W735H-1AVCF Super Illuminator Black Watch. This watch seems really good but also uncomfortable due to the similar strap design of the G-Shock. But what makes elevated it is the huge Light button, which I find very important and the extremely useful vibrating alarm since I am a very forgetful person, and sometimes I may be listening to something and won't hear my watch's alarm. Also, Casio Men's WV58A-1AVCR Waveceptor Atomic Digital Watch: Has a similar designed strap (comfortable), which, as mentioned before, is what makes the Casio F91W-1 Classic Resin Strap Digital Sport Watch good! It also has EL lighting, which is far superior to LED lighting I think. Furthermore, the button for the light is medium-sized and is at the right side of the watch, which is so-so (i.e. workable). With a picky and frugal personality like mine, it's extremely difficult to find a perfect, inexpensive watch ($15-$25).

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: This is the most classic example of a digital watch. It tells the time, it tells the date and day of the week, it has an alarm, and it has a stopwatch. The numbers are easy to read. The watch is comfortable to wear, it doesn't weigh much, and it is of such low depth that you needn't worry about it getting in the way at all. The buttons, while small, are still easy to use. At a budget price, you get everything you need. The one and only drawback: the light is darn near useless. It's a dim yellowish light coming from the left side of the display only, so in a very dark place you might be able to make out the hour, at least. Unfortunately, at the price, what do you expect? Otherwise, so long as you don't need to know what time it is in the dark, this is a useful and attractive watch at a very affordable price.

column14: Seems like a good watch so far. Because itâ€™s so cheap I figured Iâ€™d shower with it on and then let you all know how it faired. Took a 15 minute shower and it did great! No water that I can see on the inside. I have no doubt it would handle a heavy rain just fine. Very simple and easy to operate, didnâ€™t need the manual. Only downside is this pink version cost more than double what the black version does, but at $26 itâ€™s still a good deal. I would buy it again. Good beater watch and the pink is nice to mix things up. I have seen videos of people running over this watch with a car and if still being fine, so it should last. The first thing that gives out on these watches is usually the band, which from what I hear lasts about 2-3 years, after which point you can either buy a new band and replace it, or just pay a tiny bit extra and get a whole new watch.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: PROS > Affordable > Fits well on smaller and medium wrist sizes > Low-profile, sleek, and very light-weight > Long battery life > Can take a beating > Alarm and stopwatch > Legible and easy to setup and use CONS > The backlight is near-useless, even in a pitch black room, very hard to see the display with the light on > Resin material feels cheap > Buttons are a bit hard to press and your wrist can hit the 12/24 hour button > The watch wears small as advertised, be wary those with medium to larger wrists > The strap is okay but seems to fall apart before the watch > Only WR, other Casio watches are rated for 50m or 100m It's a great, simple daily beater watch. It does everything it's advertised to, and it keeps time more accurate than thousand dollar timepieces. It's only $10-$15, so don't expect anything fancy. The backlight sucks and if you do need to use the watch in low light, I recommend an alternate model such as an Illuminator or one with E/L Backlight.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I went with this watch because I was previously using a smart watch daily, but was growing tired of constantly having to charge it and having it run out of battery. When I first received the watch, I was a little surprised with how small it was. The face of the watch is just under the size of a quarter (see the attached picture), so if you're on the bigger side, this might look really small on you. The wrist strap included, as I can't imagine it being comfortable on those who have bigger wrists. The watch itself is comfortable, and I barely notice that I'm wearing it. It is easy to read during the day, and I have found the month / date feature to be super useful as I'm constantly forgetting what day it is. Setting the watch is really easy, and I like that you can easily switch between 24 hour and 12 hour mode. The built in light is just OK. The light really only lights up one side of the watch which can make it a challenge to read at night if your eyes aren't adjusted. All in all, not too much to complain about given the price point. If those things aren't deal breakers for you, the watch is a really solid value, and great for every day wear.
column16: A very solid every day watch. Pretty small though.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: This watch is very water resistant and practical. I've taken it in the shower, a spring, and a pool and had no problems. Two things I don't like is how it feels and how easily the date switches on its own. The wrist part is made of of a material that kind of sticks to you like your skin does to certain fabrics on a hot summer day. It's really irritating to me, but I'm sensitive to that. My solution has been to wear it as loose as possible. A more annoying problem is that that the day of the week and date keep changing themselves. I think the button gets pressed as I am moving about. This is bad if you think it's one day and its actually not. I usually catch it and correct it, but that facilitates the need for a phone which contradicts the whole reason why I bought the watch, to not use my phone. I think you get what you pay for and it's fine if you need a watch for the most basic purpose of time. I have not found a need for the other functions, but they seem easy enough to work after you read the instruction manual. I have had the watch for about a month and it's already a bit scratched up. I think that's okay, but it goes to show that it is not that resilient.
column16: A solid water-resistant watch, but uncomfortable wrist and unreliable date

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: You canâ€™t really beat it for the price. Iâ€™m an avid surfer and swimmer, and I canâ€™t tell you how many other cheap watches Iâ€™ve ruined by testing my luck in the water. This one lasted about a year of surfing 2-3 times a week. I wish it lasted longer, but overall I think thatâ€™s a pretty good showing for a watch thatâ€™s under $20. My only complaint would be that itâ€™s easy to accidentally push the buttons when flexing your wrist. I donâ€™t even take it off when sleeping, so this sometimes resulted in accidentally setting off the alarm in the middle of the night. Sometimes I would have to walk into another room to fix the alarm settings without waking up my girlfriend. If you just take it off before sleeping that would easily avoid this problem. Summary: Does it look cool? Not really. Does it track the tides, or your heart rate, or altitude? Absolutely not. Is it perfect? No. Will it last forever? Also no. But does it keep good time, cost less than $20, and stand up to a decent amount of abuse, including water? Yeah, it does.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: Anyone who has owned an F-91w knows it a a great watch so I will only talk about the differences compared to a standard F-91w. First the watch band. It is slightly darker than it appears in the amazon picture (see my picture) but overall looks good. It does however feel significantly different to the standard F-91w. It is much less flexible and as a result, it's less comfortable. It is also glossy which causes some annoying squeaks against the buckle and case. It might go away over time as the band wears down, but it thought I should mention it. My biggest complaint however is with the case. Instead of making it transparent grey like the band, they just painted it gray. It looks ok in some lights and really bad in others. I know it would cost more to make the case translucent, but it would have made it look way better. It's not a bad watch which is why I'm still giving it 4 stars, but especially for $25 I was expecting a bit more. If it ever drops to 10-15$ like most other F-91w's than it might be worth it but at the current price I would skip it.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I recently purchased the Casio F91W-1 Watch, and I am extremely pleased with my purchase. The watch has a retro design that (in my opinion) never goes out of style, and the resin strap is durable, light, and comfortable to wear. The digital display is easy to read, and the stopwatch, alarm, and hourly chime features are very useful. However, the backlight feature is not very bright, and it's difficult to read the time in low light conditions. Overall, the Casio F91W-1 is a reliable and functional timepiece that offers great value for its price. If you don't mind the backlight, I highly recommend it, but for those who ABSOLUTELY need a bright backlight, I suggest looking for another watch.

column14: Itâ€™s perfect ! But do wish you could leave the backlight on without holding the button.only reason why I left 4 stars! But if you donâ€™t care Iâ€™d say this is a 5 star watch! (I use it for vet tech school / everyday use and I even have a Apple Watch but honestly love this as much)

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I have been using this watch for around 5 months now, in adverse and harsh conditions, and this watch is doing phenomenally well! I believe it is rated as being "water resistant", and it certainly is. I have fully submerged the watch multiple times, it is frequently exposed to running tap water, it is hit hard against steel, banged up against concrete, and it keeps perfect time and is still fully functional. It has a few good scratches on it now, but that is to be expected of any watch that is put through what I've put this one through. Outstanding little watch, especially for the price! Now, it isn't perfect. The button that switches the time display modes (switches from 1:45 to 13:45) keeps unintentionally getting pressed so that the time is displayed in the "24 hour" mode. Not a big deal, I just prefer the other mode. Also, this is not a fancy looking watch. It is very basic, and dare I say, cheap looking. Again, a minor thing. All in all, I love this watch, I wear it every day and I'm almost lost without it. Never wore a watch before this one. I constantly check it for the time and the date. It also has a stop watch feature and an alarm. I never use either, so I am unable to comment further on those features. And it has a good sized display (I can still read it a couple of feet away without my glasses). An excellent everyday/beater watch that won't win a beauty show, but will keep on working whenever you need it to.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: (SKIP TO END FOR QUICK VERDICT WITH LESS DETAIL) DETAILED ANALYSIS: This watch is great if you need a simple yet solid digital watch to keep track of overall time. If you have an active lifestyle and are looking for an affordable watch to pick up, then I would highly recommend it. I am personally satisfied with the ergonomics, and the general build seems sturdy and well constructed. The water resistance also seems to be satisfactory. If I had to point out any doubts in the build of this watch, the only questionable part is the band. The feel of the band does not feel like that of a band made from premium material. So far, the watch is still fully intact and functioning and the band seems like it can sustain under fairly tough circumstances, however, I believe the best way to upgrade this watch would be to interchange the band. Another aspect that needs room for improvement is the backlight. The back light barely lights up half of the watch interface (see photos for example), and it's actually very disappointing. If you are going to depend highly on this watch in the dark, I probably wouldn't recommend it. Lastly, the watch overall looks slightly small compared to PROS: Affordable - low risk investment for budget minded Utility - very useful if you care more about uses than looks Simplicity - easy to use and control Sturdy - can withstand most circumstances CONS: Cheap Band - the band 'feels' cheap Terrible Backlight - light does not provide sufficient visibility in the dark Aesthetics - kinda looks small on wrist; it's not ugly, it just doesn't look nice lol OVERALL PERSONAL VERDICT: For a digital watch that's $11.49, I like it and would recommend it for an affordable utility watch to quickly pick up.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: This review is in two parts: First, the timepiece itself is reasonably accurate and the battery does last a long time. The only design flaw is the omission of a month display. Sure, most of us know what the current month is, but why not also have it digitally displayed beside the day of month on the face of this watch? The second part of review is the strap that comes with this watch. These straps are made from a man-made material that slowly grows more and more brittle over time. It will eventually break, guaranteed. This usually happens near the point where the left and right straps buckle together. The watch itself will outlast the original strap plus a couple of replacement straps. I have a supply of perfectly good digital watches still keeping time, but now sitting in a storage drawer because I can no longer find suitable straps. Even if I could, they are nearly as expensive as a brand new watch. So, I purchase another $12 Casio watch because they are good for everyday use. Speaking of straps: the strap on this watch is awful. The reason for this is the loop that secures the end of strap in place after putting watch on your wrist. The loop is floating, that is, it is not fixed in any one position on the strap. This causes it to move out of position and no longer keeps end of strap secured. That means the strap is forever catching on everything and forcing the watch to rotate around on your wrist. If you like aggravation, you'll love this strap.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: This is a wonderful watch and definitely a classic. This was one of the first of its kind and massively popular. Over time the price has decreased now it is one of the best deals there is in terms of watches. Pros -Price. For what you pay, this watch is just fantastic and very solid. This is a military approved watch that can take a beating, and is nice for everyday use or athletic/work use. -Weight. This watch notably lighter than others, and this has its ups and it's downs, but it makes it nice because it is not a sinfully watch weighing on your wrist. Personally, I like big faced watches, but this is a nice change. -Functions. On the default, there is obviously the time (with seconds), as well as the day, date, and ability to change whether it is in 12 or 24 hour format. You can toggle through to find alarm and stopwatch mode. You can set an alarm to go off at any time of the day, as well as set the hourly alarm so the watch beeps every hour on the hour. This can be a handy function when at school, work, homework, etc. when time management is important. -Durability. Though it is no G-Shock (which I highly reccomend because they are great watches), it is nice and pretty durable as well. It is obviously water resistant, so swimming, showering, wearing in rain, etc. with this watch is no problem. Despite it's small size, it feels fairly sturdy and is fine to wear in tough conditions. -Battery life. Though I have not come close to reaching the time for a battery change, I have learned from research as well as friends who have the watch that the battery lasts forever, which is wonderful but not exactly surprising. Since the watch is so small and simple, and it is digital, the battery on this rather than lasting the average 2-3 years, should last more like 5-10 years, which is fantastic. Cons -Size. The first thing I noticed upon unboxing this watch was that it was noticeably smaller than I had expected. While I knew it was not a large faced watch, the face was smaller than it appeared to me on Amazon. I have gotten used to it but this is something to note if size matters much to you. -Strap. The strap on this watch is decent, but by no means impressive. It is pretty thin and not one of the nicest looking bands Casio makes. It does the job and seems strong enough, though over time that may change. Fortunately, that is why you can purchase replacement and different bands for it! With the right tools they are changeable; you can do this is at most watch or jewlery shops. -Buttons. The buttons are pretty small and not always easy to press. While the locations of them is pretty standard, they are small and not always the easiest to access. -Appearance. Though it is a classic, that does not neccesarily mean that it looks professional or very high quality. It does not look bad, especially for the average person looking for an everyday watch or a sports watch, but for someone wanting to look professional, I think it goes without saying that this may not be the watch for you. Overall, this is a great watch and definitely worth the $9 or $10! It is a classic watch that is popular for a reason. Great buy and highly reccoment.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I bought this watch to replace a 32 year old Casio. After doing my research, I bought the Ironman Classic 30 and a Casio F91W. The Ironman is a better watch, but The price and ruggedness of the Casio canâ€™t be beat. First, I need to put this review in context. I am a reasonably, if not very active, forty-something. I am fit, but I have a 40 year oldâ€™s eyes and sensibilities. I use this watch primarily Just to tell time at the gym, hiking, biking or maybe swimming. I have some secondary use for it as a timer or stopwatch, but that is about it. As you might have guessed, I am a bit of a watch minimalist, so I was happy with the size of the watch. However, I am realizing that a 35mm watch may not be optimal for a 40 year oldâ€™s eyes. To be clear I think the watch is perfectly legible/ readable, but the larger face of the Ironman is easier to read and better for older eyes. Personally I find the controls for the watch intuitive and easier to use (other than the smaller buttons) than the Ironman, but that is coming from a guy who used a similar watch for 32 years. I have two complaints that kept me from giving five stars. First, the light on the watch isnâ€™t bright enough to be much useâ€” but again this is literally the view of a middle aged man. Younger or more near-sighted eyes may find the light perfectly adequate. Secondly, I actually would have appreciated a timer function and this watch doesnâ€™t have one. Overall, i give this four stars. Ease of use, price and ruggednesses are this watches best attributes; an inadequate light and a lack of a timer are its biggest weaknesses. So if you have $25 more to spend and donâ€™t mind (or like) a more chunky watch, Iâ€™d recommend the Ironman Classic 30 over this watch. However, if you want to save a few bucks and your eyes are sharper than mine, the Casio is a fine choice.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: Well. I contemplated for some time if I should write a review for this ultra affordable watch or not ... after some thoughts, this Casio deserves every bit of my highest recommendations so I decided to go for it If you are reading this ... either you stumbled on the F91W-1 by looking at some of the cheapest Amazon stocked watches Or you read from Wikipedia, or some watch forums, or other sources that this Casio is the favorite among the terrorist group. Well regardless what your motivation is ... this watch is worth every penny. Some background information. I been collecting mechanical watches for about 16+ years. And right now I own over 50 watches... From this humble $11 Casio to a few Rolex, Zenith, Omega, JLC that cost 500 times its price. I also service some of my own mechanical pieces. Although I do not have much experience with quartz watches. I do know quite a bit about material, design and many aspects of a proper horological machine. And the down right truth is, there is nothing this Casio can't do. As far as a practical machine, it can beat up your datejust/ submariner any day of the week. (Although this might not be that big of a deal in todays cell phone oriented world) Pros: It is designed to be simple and intuitive, the trait of most Casios. Button placement and functions are down right instinctive once you use it for a day or two. It is deadly accurate (duh), its quartz. The battery life is an amazing 7 years (given you use certain functions only once or twice a day.) Although some upgraded version has 10 year or solar battery. The battery life is more then reasonable for any practical purpose. This is the most comfortable watch I own, due to one reason - the weight. It feels like you are wearing a feather or nothing at all. 20 grams to be exact... or 0.7oz. Crazy how light this thing is. The retro styling is another plus .. it may not have been cool in the 80~90s. The nerdy black resin square case is now hip again... The construction of this watch is very well thought out to simplify the manufacturing process. Which, btw, is done in Thailand. Case is a single piece resin with slightly protruding plastic crystal. All the electronics are on a one piece of ic board. The case back is made from stamped stainless steel, secured by 4 screws, and the interior is where the alarm speaker goes. A rather large rubber gasket surrounds the movement. Light weight rubber strap with some mysterious reflective inclusion. Cons Water resistance: The case construction does not allow any serious form of water resistance... as a matter of fact, in the Casio manual they do not recommend anything more then hand washing. The real problem is the pushers, they lack any gasket so water will pour in when use underwater. The tolerance of the case and SS back is decent. But the gasket sits too low so a 100% secure seal will not be possible. Crystal seems to be glued into place, so no problem with water there. I think degrees of water resistance is how Casio separates their cheapest products from the slightly more expensive one. You can hear something rattle when you shake this watch ... it is nothing major however If you are used to today's super large watch... namely, Graham, Panerai, 44mm, 50mm or the likes. This watch will look puny to you at 35mm. But if you like most watches in the 70s or 80s ... this is just the right size. The bottom line is ... this is a hell of a watch for the money. As utilitarian as it could be yet possess some of the funk from the past decades. It also carries a good amount of interesting back stories if you tell people about its popularity among the terrorists. A great watch! And the best $9.99 I spend on a watch.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I've been wearing this watch (probably a total of 15 purchased) since its debut in 1989, a release that coincided with my getting into jogging. I've trained for, and run, marathons with it, had its alarm inadvertently chirp in too many business meetings to count, been teased about it by family friends and colleagues, and stuck with it because it's cool easy and replaceable without hassle. Recently, my wife and daughter saw it included in the collection at the Design Museum of London, and I was somewhat vindicated for what friends dismissed as a quirky style choice. When cellphones started to tell time, I took a break from the watch but then realized the phone was and is an intrusive timepiece. Like the watch design, I have some years on me, and its main sports use for me is pickleball match timing. For 35 years through changes in technology, consumerism, and even brand challenges from bad guys who abused the 91-w's sturdy pragmatism, Casio has never changed this beauty. It's still cheap--much easier to buy a new watch than replace a snapped band, which is a bi-annual occurrence. It keeps accurate time--set the new watch to the second with a cell network the first day you wear it, and by the time the band breaks the deviance will be less than 10 seconds (if that.) The calendar dates are easy to manage, which makes leap years even more fun! That WR (water resistant!) means you can swim, shower, and cook with it. And that wan light, in the middle of the night, won't wake your partner when you are visited by waking night-thoughts that make you check the time. Best. Watch. Ever!

There are clear instructions on how to set the date, alarm, etc. Honestly for such a small watch it has many functions. On top of that the numbers are very easy to read, it is waterproof (accidentally tested that), and the light is great in dark lighting. In terms of size I have a giant wrist and it fits nicely so it should fit pretty much everyone as well. Finally, I recommend this watch because I had the same model and it lasted for years.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: The F-91W has a couple of advantages over its bigger G-Shock relatives like the DW-5600E. Its tiny case size and weight make it easy to forget you're wearing. For small to average wrists, this watch should wear just fine. It will be too small for an 8 inch wrist or larger. The 8mm thick case will easily slip under long sleeved shirts and jackets when many G-Shocks won't. It's also tough enough for probably 95% of people. I haven't managed to to break the watch and it survives lap swimming with no problems (even when its not rated for that at all.) But on the other side, the G-Shocks are rated for far better shock and water resistance and the materials quality are much better (and you'll notice immediately when you handle them.) You will get what you pay for. The buttons are exposed on the side and that makes them extremely easy to operate. Once you memorize the layout, it's extremely easy to set a quick alarm and switch the hourly chime on/off. If you prefer 12/24 hour time in airports or train stations, you can easily switch with one button press. The alarm volume is actually pretty decent as well. It's not going to wake a really heavy sleeper, but it's louder than most G-Shock models. Test it and see if it's loud enough to wake you at home before relying on it in travel situations. A lot of people complain about the small, weak micro LED light. I get that. But it's a compromise that keeps the case thin at 8mm. When you use the improved full-screen LED illuminator or EL backlight tech, the thickness of the watch has to increase. But the micro LED light actually does its job pretty well in actual darkness. Even if your eyes aren't adjusted to the dark, you can easily see hours and minutes with it. But if a bright light is important to you, spend a little more for the slightly bigger F-105W. The watch's weakest aspect is the band. The resin is cheaper than a G-Shock and it lacks the curved lugs that help it wrap around the wrist. Chlorinated water from pools, sweat, and salt water will all weaken the resin over time. Over-tightening the band will stress it more too. To make the band last longer, rinse sweat and salt off the band and dry it at the end of the day, and wear it loose enough to fit one finger between the band and your wrist. All-in-all though, the F-91W is an absolute winner if watch thinness and alarm/hourly chime are important to you. Highly recommended.
column16: An excellent choice if you value a slim, lightweight watch

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: There are simply too many reviews of this watch. So instead of a review Iâ€™d like to share with you a conversation I had the other day with one of my co-workers. Co-work: Whatâ€™s that on your wrist? Did you borrow that watch from you 10 year old son? Itâ€™s so small and cheap looking. I didnâ€™t think you ever knew how to read a LCD display. Casio F-91W Owner: Itâ€™s a Casio F-91W, and no I didnâ€™t borrow it from my son, but sometimes I let him borrow it from me. I know that I typically, prefer analogue watches with a mechanical or automatic movements. I did need to read the instruction manual I figure out how to read the digital display. Once I figured out that the colon on the display is separating the hours (on the left) from the minute (on the right) and the smaller numbers on the far right represent the seconds; itâ€™s actual easier to read that the 3 hand analogues. Co-work: So, why did you buy this watch? It doesnâ€™t seem to fit in with your Seiko 5, Orient, HMT, Citizen Eco-drive or that Chinese knock-off of an expensive German watch you canâ€™t afford, that you typically wear to the office. Casio F-91W Owner: Itâ€™s nothing like my other watches, but this watch is one of the great classics. This model was first made in 1991, and was the smart watch of its time. The features and price-point is also unbeatable. I got it specifically because I am going on vacation to the beach and I wanted an affordable watch to wear of the beach and in the pool. This is proven technology; this model has been manufacture for over two decades and itâ€™s almost bombproof. Co-work: Doesnâ€™t WR mean Water Resistant; like splash and rain resistant only. I thought you need at least a 50m or 100m rating to take it swimming. Casio F-91W Owner: You are completely correct, and completely wrong. A watch worth worrying about needs at least a 50m or preferable a 100m rating just for swimming on the surface more or less. Personally, I wouldnâ€™t take any of my other watches swimming on purpose, even though some of them have a 100m rating. However, this Casio is very modest in cost and I consider the manufactures water resistance rating is very under stated. Sure, if I ruin this watch swimming, the manufacture going to tell me to fly a kite, if I made a warranty claim, but this is a ten dollar watch. If you have ten dollars to wager, like I do, throw caution to the wind or perhaps dive in head first with it. Itâ€™s a lot like jaywalking, itâ€™s not recommended, but you not trueing living your life to the fullest if you follow every rule. I sure a G-Shock with 200m water rating is manufacture with more seals and offers better water protection, but I also think that the water resistance rating is partially just marketing to separate Casioâ€™s $10 watches from their $100 watches. Iâ€™ve taken this watch in the ocean and dove in swimming pools with no problems. Iâ€™d recommend not pressing the buttons when itâ€™s wet, as well as not being a cry baby if you ruin it, but this watch is suitable for swimming in my book. Co-work: Wow, what a risk taker, they must be paying you too much, if you have ten bucks to risk like that. So you say itâ€™s was the smart watch of its time back in the day. Whatâ€™s so smart about this watch? Casio F-91W Owner: Well for starters, a day-date complication with annual calendar, that only needs to be corrected for leap years. It switches between AM/PM and 24 hour format with a single push of a button. It has a hourly repeater that can be turned on and off. A stopwatch function, and am alarm. Did I mention it has a very dim light, and I believe it was y2k compliant nearly a decade in advance. Co-work: Wow, I think my iwatch can do all that, but I donâ€™t know how to. I also paid a lot more than you, and I canâ€™t take it swimming. How about battery life? Whereâ€™s the charger plug? Is it self-winding, like you Seiko 5, and going to die after a few days off your wrist? I know for sure that in 1991 there was no such thing as wireless charging. Casio F-91W Owner: Itâ€™s much for low tech then wireless charging, or self-winding. Itâ€™s powered by a replaceable battery. Casio claims 7-years on a single battery with no daily recharging required. Itâ€™s more likely that the strap will break, before the battery will need to be replaced. It doesnâ€™t need any sunlight either, some people claim to get 10 years on a single battery, it really depends on how frequent the light and alarm functions are utilized. In theory you could hide out in a cave for years without worrying about charging or replacing the battery. Co-work: Hey, one more question. I know you are married, but ascetically speaking, do you think I watch like this would be helpful in attraction women? Itâ€™s kind of ugly looking. Well unless sheâ€™s a gold digger type, but you donâ€™t need that. Any women that canâ€™t appreciate a classic watch like this doesnâ€™t even desire to go dutch at McDonalds with you. column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: Most of this watch's reviews on Amazon and Youtube are right. This watch is good, even if its outclassed by only spending a little more. It's slim, comfortable, readable, and offers good functionality for the price point. It redefines it, actually, and that's the main appeal of the watch, apart from its subdued nature. Some things I want to add: the light is indeed mediocre, but not as bad as people say unless you have poor eyesight. Durability is not a tank, but is nothing to laugh at for the money. Whether you like the aesthetics or not will depend on whether you like small, plastic, retro digitals. Strap is a weak point in the watch, but will take a while to break unless you're rough with it; nylon and rubber replacements on ebay exist. Solid buy for the slim-budgeted or for newcomers to traditional wristwatches.

column2: Casio Men's 'Vintage' Quartz Metal and Resin Casual Watch, Color:Black (Model: F-91WM-9ACF), Black/Gold
column14: I needed a very basic watch for the one part of the workweek when I'm in an area without clocks, and I'm not one of those young people what carry their cellular telephones with them everywhere! So I looked all over the place for this kind of watch, which I remember being ubiquitous for years, and cheap-cheap-cheap. I start looking, and guess what: None of the discount stores don't carry 'em no more. But Casio still makes the original, upon which all the cheapie knockoffs are based...upon. I was looking to spend, what, $5 at most for the dollar store version. But I had no choice and ended up getting the name brand version for about $14. And it works fine, just fine. I don't need the alarm, I haven't used the light yet, I'm not in the military so I don't need the 24-hour format, but those are features that are included. I just needed it to keep accurate time, and that it does. That it does, friend. That it does. That it does. And speaking of time, I see that my three minutes are up, and I want to thank the council for listening to me and I hope going forward we can find a solution.

column2: AX Armani Exchange Men's Chronograph Silver-Tone Stainless Steel Bracelet Watch (Model: AX2509)
column14: Before this watch, I was just a guy who asked for the time and was victim of countless "time for you to get a watch" jokes. It was time for change. I looked up some nice fossil, but I didn't want to become a part of the system. Those silver watches just weren't me. But this popped up on a suggestion list, and it was love at first sight. I quickly ordered this majestic wrist assessory and spent the 5.99 for next day shipping, who could resist? After it delievered I was nervous, it was a first date you know? So I tried her on, and she fit like my wrist was meant to be inside her the whole time. I now polish her every day, give her a good rinse, a kiss before bed, and I reset the time every morning so she can rest. She's my girl. I bought some new sapphire glass so she can never break, and she deserves the finest gems. She's all I have since my wife left me. She claimed I loved the watch more then her.. I can't say she's wrong. Now Miss Armani Exchange and I will get married, I'll spoil my princess.

column14: This is a great looking watch and it serves that purpose. I appreciate fine watches and truthfully, this is not a fine watch. It has a cheaper quartz movement and is really nothing special. I like how it looks however and that;s the reason I purchased it. Something to note that I did not realize before buying it is that the bezel is not rounded but is a x-agon (like a pentagon but with more sides, I just didn't count them all). I would have preferred that it was rounded instead because I feel like the sharp edges of the bezel makes it look a bit tacky. Truthfully, it is not very noticeable so it wasn't enough to remove a star. Keep and eye out for a sale and try not to purchase this watch at full price.

column2: AMAZTIM Smart Watch, 60 Days Extra-Long Battery, 50M Waterproof, Rugged Military Bluetooth Call(Answer/Dial Calls) Fitness Tracker, 1.85" Ultra Large HD Display, AI Voice Assistant 24H Sleep Monitor
column14: I bought this watch to go to Alaska as it was supposed to be a highly rated rugged watch. It paired with my Galaxy S9+ but I never had 1 text message work through it. I never was able to answer the phone by itself without the watch picking up the call. The watch picked up and projected the phone call every time. The same would happen when I would listen to music or watch a video. The media played through the watch no matter what. It did not measure heart rate. It does not received email. Every thing you would buy a smart watch to do, this watch does not deliver or does wrong. column2: AMAZTIM Smart Watch, 60 Days Extra-Long Battery, 50M Waterproof, Rugged Military Bluetooth Call(Answer/Dial Calls) Fitness Tracker, 1.85" Ultra Large HD Display, AI Voice Assistant 24H Sleep Monitor
column14: So, first day with this watch and I was excited to use the blood pressure feature. At work, I let 3 different people try it to see what it would register... we were all the same +-1,2/1,2 (sys/dia).. ok.. because I am diagnosed stage 2 hypertension and typically am around 120-130/70-80 (medicated and caused by kidney disease- not important but I am very knowledgeable on bp)... but it read 115/74 (+-1,2/1,2) for all 4 of us. Then, I used the sauna for 30 min after a workout (dry sauna @190degrees)- during this- it continually read the same as it had at work with 4 different people. Zero change. I could literally feel my pulse throughout my body and it was reading 115/72 in the sauna over and over.. the entire time I was in there sweating in 190 degrees with a real bpm of 140-150. The bpm is accurate *sometimes. As it would vary between 54 in the sauna, and then climb to 150's and back down. Not moving it at all. I was excited to be able to "ball park" measure my bp throughout the day vs using a real bp cuff/reader for only $90... DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. This watch is garbage and I will be returning it.

column14: I purchased this as an alternative to some of the Fitbit options, but it hasn't measured up. My wife owns a Fitbit and she never has issues with her device tracking sleep. Additionally, I am frustrated that unless I have it tight enough to leave marks and in a specific spot on my wrist it will not give me my vitals. I do like that it allows me to answer and make calls and I especially appreciate the fact that I can pause and resume my music. The latter features are why I considered it, but I do not see the value, even with the black friday discounts, for the health aspects. I would recommend against getting the product, for now, if you are looking for a health tracker. I am going to give it a bit more time before I decide to return it.

column2: AMAZTIM Smart Watch, 60 Days Extra-Long Battery, 50M Waterproof, Rugged Military Bluetooth Call(Answer/Dial Calls) Fitness Tracker, 1.85" Ultra Large HD Display, AI Voice Assistant 24H Sleep Monitor
column14: First, the rugged military claim is false. This watch could in no way handle my Jiu-Jitsu training regimen, it definitely would not survive actual military combat. If it can't handle my Jiu-Jitsu training then it doesn't do me any good, as that is what I purchased it for. Second, it is too touch-sensitive. A minor bump would cause the watch's workout function to pause or switch to a different routine entirely. Without accurate tracking, I'm unable to monitor my progress and kcal burn. Again, it makes this item pointless for me. Third, the sleep function. I never tested it, as the watch is uncomfortable to wear while sleeping. Finally, the APP had many functions that I could have found useful, however; it lacked daily, weekly, or monthly tracking. Not important, but annoying. This item has failed to live up to its title "AMAZTIM Smart Watch, 60 Days Extra-Long Battery, 50M Waterproof, Rugged Military Bluetooth Call(Answer/Dial Calls) Fitness Tracker." It isn't rugged enough for the military, and it is a so-so fitness tracker.

column2: AMAZTIM Smart Watch, 60 Days Extra-Long Battery, 50M Waterproof, Rugged Military Bluetooth Call(Answer/Dial Calls) Fitness Tracker, 1.85" Ultra Large HD Display, AI Voice Assistant 24H Sleep Monitor
column14: This watch is more for kids to play with. The watch shows me a sleep while watching tv. I'm disabled, as such, I don't do a whole lot of walking; I'd be hard pressed to walk 1000 paces in a day. Yet, the watch shows walking anywhere from 3000 to 6000 paces a day. Heart rate and blood pressure are more than 30% off in either direction and inconsistent. Understandable this isn't a medical device but, it should have better accuracy, let alone consistencies. And the watch should know the difference between when a person is a sleep or sitting in a chair watching tv. Returned for a refund.

column14: So let's start by saying this watch is INDESTRUCTIBLE! Hard work, swimming pools, bumps and bangs, it stands up to it all and has an amazing battery life! I charge weekly with heavy use. It looks nice and has a large easy to read screen. But that's really all it does well. column2: AMAZTIM Smart Watch, 60 Days Extra-Long Battery, 50M Waterproof, Rugged Military Bluetooth Call(Answer/Dial Calls) Fitness Tracker, 1.85" Ultra Large HD Display, AI Voice Assistant 24H Sleep Monitor
column14: 5 things I want in a smartwatch, ranked in priority. 1. It has to keep an accurate calorie consumption count. 2. It has to have accurate blood pressure. 3. It has to pair well with your phone. 4. It has to read and write to Apple Health (For my purposes) 5. it needs to be easy to use. Everything else really is of little value to me. I don't care how many steps I take in a day. I don't care what my heart rate is. I don't care what my SpO2 values are, or how much, or what kind of sleep I get. All of that is extraneous to my purposes, but if it works, that's fine too. I just don't need it. As you can see from the picture, I worked out for 2and 3/4 hours, and according to this watch, I burned 120 calories. On this particular day, my BMR (Basal Metabolic Rate) was 1805. That means that my body is going to burn1805 calories just for my heart to beat, my lungs to breathe, my brain, kidneys, liver, and vital organs to function, while the rest of me is completely dormant. That means that in 2 and 3/4 of an hour just to live, I will burn 206.822917 calories. Yet this gem of a watch says I burned 120 calories. I must be dead. All of these figures are KCal, so this isn't an apples to oranges comparison. By contrast, I also wore a fitbit, which accurately tracks my caloric consumption. My fitbit recorded 451 calories burned, which is much more believable to me. Why it's important If you don't know how many calories you are burning, you can't know how many calories to consume. It's that simple. If you are looking to get rid of fat, you have to increase metabolism through muscle growth. That means you need to consume roughly 100 calories more than you burn. If you don't have an accurate picture of what you are burning, you are lost. If you want to weigh less, regardless of fat content, eat less than you burn. But the critical piece is what is missing from this watch. That being said, I will keep it anyway, because this particular watch keeps very accurate blood pressure, and It's a lot easier to do with a watch than messing around with a cuff. So at least it has that going for it. Before I bought this watch, I read the questions and reviews, and concluded that maybe this one would keep accurate caloric counts. Maybe there are watches out there that do. Mine does not. Some of the reviews said that the blood pressure was off. Mine is on the money with a cuff, so I haven't had that experience. But the makers of this watch need to find a way to track the entire calorie burn, not just calories from movement. Because the most vital purpose of the watch is a fail, the best I can give it is 2 stars. Sorry manufacturer, but that's the best I will do for this model.
